span.marquee: Under Governor Northam's direction, all Staunton City Schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

span.p: The next meeting of the Staunton City Shcool Board will be on April 27, 2020 at 12:00pm.
The meeting will be an electronic communications meeting.
Citizens are encouraged to listen to the live audio feed on SCS-TV13 or through our website by clicking here.
The agenda and supporting documents can be found by clicking here.

Public input will be accepted in advance. Citizens who wish to comment on an agenda item or other school division matter should email the Clerk at blovekam@staunton.k12.va.us no later than 4:00 pm on Friday, April 24. Comments should be limited in length to what can be read aloud during the meeting in 2 minutes or less.

a.title: Go to comments for School Board Meeting

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: COVID19

span.strong: efforts relative to the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19),

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) Information

strong.span: When you shape education, you shape

p.span: Respond to the 2020 Census and inform funding for educational programs that benefit our children, like after-school activities, school meal programs, and Head Start. It's more than just a count, it's an opportunity to shape the next generation.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020 Census

span.p: Attention SHS Seniors! GRASP is still open and available to answer your FAFSA/financial aid questions by email (pfeyerabend@grasp4va.org) or by phone (804-527-7741). The GRASP website is: https://grasp4va.org/

a.title: Go to comments for GRASP

p.span: The 2020-21 Academic Calendar is now available.
to view or download the new calendar.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-21 Academic Calendar

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.em: Presented by PEATC in collaboration with the Virginia Department of Education (VDOE)

span.p: A FREE parent friendly 5-week self-paced online transition course. It is never too early to start learning about students with disabilities transitioning to adulthood. It is never too early to begin taking steps to prepare for the future!

a.title: Go to comments for Transition University

p.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;
p.strong: Staunton City Schools has partnered with ESS to manage our substitute teacher program.

p.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;
font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;
p.img: ESS hires, trains, and places talented substitute personnel and offers a variety of positions to match your availabilityand interests. You receive the training and support you need to enter the classroom confident and prepared!

p.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;
font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left; padding-left: 180px;

span.p: Apply now to join the ESS team!

p.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left; padding-left: 180px;

span.p: For more information, visit the Substitute Information page!

p.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: medium; text-align: left;

a.title: Go to comments for Employment Opportunities - Substitute Positions

div.p: Parent Portal is now open for all students in grades K-12. Sign-up for Parent Portal is required for all parents who wish to modify their call system preferences regarding events throughout the year and schedule changes related to weather.

a.title: Go to comments for Parent Portal Information

a.span: FAMIS Student Health Care Coverage Available

div.p: FAMIS is Virginia's health insurance program for children. It makes health care affordable for children of eligible families.

a.title: Go to comments for FAMIS Student Health Care Coverage Available
Go to comments for Free and Reduced Lunch Application

div.p: Staunton City Schools is a Virginia Values Veterans certified employer!

a.title: Go to comments for Virginia Values Veterans

div.p: Visit the Staunton City Schools Health and Medical Services page for the latest health and medical information, as well as all of the Division's health and medical services/guidelines.

a.title: Go to comments for Health & Medical Information
